website_summaries.verdict: The Nike Free RN Flyknit 3.0 was able to receive positive responses from those who have gotten the chance to wear it and experience its features. This neutral running shoe was well-liked for its flexible construction, agreeable cushioning quality, and lightweight components. The minimalistic style was also given due praise by fans of non-bulky performance footwear. On the other hand, several consumers weren’t happy with the harshly shifting removable insole and the apparently irritating interior sleeve.Road running enthusiasts and fans of low-mileage sprints are the target audience of the Nike Free RN Flyknit 3.0.
pros: Those who have tested the Nike Free RN Flyknit 3.0 felt that the minimalistic design complemented the notion of having freedom of movement
A consumer commented that the underfoot cushioning was able to support the foot without becoming too unwieldy
The slip-on design was well-liked, especially since it allows the foot to settle into the foot-compartment with ease
The stretchy upper unit didn’t hinder the natural bending or swelling capacity of the foot when running, according to reviews
This lightweight construction of this Nike running shoe became a highlight for those who have tried it
cons: The removable insole tended to slip towards the front of the interior chamber, some users complained
A couple of people reported that the inner sleeve rubbed against the foot uncomfortably

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I already have this shoe in another color and that's the reason why I had to order another pair. The most comfortable shoe I ever owned from Nike since the Terra Humaras. It feels like I'm barefooted almost with protection on my feet ( if that makes sense,lol) overall, cool product ,cool color, cool shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Praying Mantis 52

customer_reviews.title: Runs small?
customer_reviews.text: Runs smaller than other Nike or maybe it’s just this style but it is not a very comfortable shoe. I have many other Nike’s all the same size and they are all great these not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Desjardins

customer_reviews.title: What's your size?
customer_reviews.text: The purchase was made, because I was starting a new workout program and needed shoes to feel comfortable in. The size I ordered was a 9.5, which is my exact size and they were tight. I kept them on the notion that I would break into them over time. They are still tight, and the insoles move during my workout. The shoes are a little less tight and more comfortable when I remove the insoles. The shoes does the job, but with the minor issues stated above is a bit of an inconvenience at times.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase of these exact shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these same shoes I have purchased. First one in a store. There the only shoes I have worn during WFH. What will I do when I have to wear pumps again? I usually wear size 7 or 7.5. These run small so I bought an 8 and they fit perfectly. Love the pattern too. Btw, I threw the older pair in the wash machine after soaking them overnight in soapy water. They cleaned up well. If it wasn't too weird, I'd have a closet of these shoes. :)
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Ugly.. Not as nice as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Free RN flyknit 3 as a dance shoe for fitdance. It has just enough tread and support to carry me through the dance fitness on carpet. Compared to Bloch’s dance fitness shoes, it grips better on the carpet. These shoes do not have all the extra padding, so I cannot imagine how you would run on pavement with these. However, even though I wanted a black version that would work well with outfits, I saw too much pattern that I really decided would not grow on me, so I gave them to my relative.
customer_reviews.author: Kreela

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: R uns a little small. Normaly wear a 10 (with room,) and these are very snug across the top of my foot and ccx seem a half size short. Hoping they will stretch out. We shall see!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out!
customer_reviews.text: After years and years of buying adidas I finally decided to try this pair of Nike. An abysmal failure. The shoes comes with insoles that run around in the shoe versus staying put. This is a really flimsy, lightweight shoe that I might use only be able to use for the beach or climbing waterfalls.
customer_reviews.author: K. N. Spence

customer_reviews.title: into "Bare-Foot" running shoes
customer_reviews.text: since my 1st pair ("New Balance") lasted 5+years, but NB doesn't offer the same style, so I went w/this "Nike"... equally perfect + you can TRUST the "Fit Guide"
customer_reviews.author: robt

customer_reviews.title: A rip off
customer_reviews.text: Not an original Nike product! It’s definitely a knockoff! Not a good quality knock of either
customer_reviews.author: Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Size 13s today. They are extremely comfortable - more so than most of my other Flyknits. But they are a little tight. I haven't noticed this in the other Flyknits I've got (2017/18 models). I'd give it 5 stars if they were 1/4" longer.
customer_reviews.author: Zevon

customer_reviews.title: Sharp shoe;a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: A bit tight, but it works. Maybe a bit uncomfortable at times, but not too much.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: fits very small
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the fit. Way too small. I had to return these. I wanted these for my house shoes.
customer_reviews.author: stan p.

customer_reviews.title: Run small and tight.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Nike shoes, all size 11.5. These ran small and TIGHT. Pretty much cut off my circulation tight. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Fat58hwy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love these, the are the best fitting, most comfortable shoes I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoes. Recommend ordering a half size bigger than normal
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pairs of this exact shoe in the exact same size/color from the Nike store. I understand that sometimes shoes can vary in size slightly, but this pair came in a full size shorter. Needless to say I couldn't even place my foot inside. Not sure what is going on here. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Anson Chu

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these, they are my fun shoes and so light on the feet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Left Feet
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box there were 2 left sided shoes. I cannot wear these and will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and able to slip on and off really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Dover83

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This is the very BEST running shoes I have ever bought in my life and will be purchasing another as a backup. Highly recommend this product to all runners/walkers
customer_reviews.author: Olusegun Odukoya

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, easy to slip on and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has an Asian vibe with the flowers and goes with so many ath-leisure pants with its tones of grey and black. Super comfortable for neighborhood walks, with or without thin athletic socks.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Dependable product delivered quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived when promised and shoes fit as advertised. I appreciated seller making sure I was satisfied- which I am!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Kinda tight but I actually really like them. Comfortable and good looking 👍🏼😎
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great! The color looks just like the photo. I like the fact that the shoes have no laces and are barefoot.-like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lining comes out every time I take shoes off
customer_reviews.text: Inside food padding comes out when I take them off
customer_reviews.author: Lauren G.

customer_reviews.title: Light & Flexible
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for efficient runners. These work for my under 10 mile runs...
customer_reviews.author: Ultradistance Runner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable kicks
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes, he says they’re really comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight!
customer_reviews.text: The length is fine but it fits a little too tight over the bridge of my feet. Otherwise lightweight which is what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: RMB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: Love the 2 day shipping and the exact size was a match. Along with the awesome deal I got on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Did I order an alarm no but I got one
customer_reviews.text: It came with a alarm on it not what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Dale biffle

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Great minimalist shoe. Considure to buy half size bigger than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Ziv

customer_reviews.title: It’s not nike men’s. It’s actually women’s
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this shoes because I’m planning to use it for work but since it said nike MEN’s shoes, I ordered my size equivalent to men’s size but when I received my order, it’s too small. I guessed it is not men’s size after all...
customer_reviews.author: Lourie

customer_reviews.title: Fits small - comfortable though
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. A little struggle to put on. Order a size larger...for real.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Roy

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up.
customer_reviews.text: Runs really tight. I wear a lot of running shoes, and understand that type of shoe is usually a little more snug than others, but these shoes are unreasonably short. Easily 3/4 of an inch shorter than another pair of Nike running shoes I have. I’d recommend a full size up when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 1/2 size bigger. Very lite. Gets a bit hot.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Go a size up from your show size.
customer_reviews.text: The review stated go a size up and I did. My husband says it fits perfect. It’s actually a size 10 in any other sneaker. So this 11 fits as such because they run small.
customer_reviews.author: EncarSan 🤍

customer_reviews.title: Best Sole Nike has ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these so much, the sole felt so good on my foot, and walking felt so good on my hips, but they're ugly AF so I returned them x-D and kept the inferior, squishier but better looking Nike Knit Run Free.
customer_reviews.author: David Wallace

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Free Rn Flyknit 3.0 Track & Field Shoes
